poem:
The Pride Parade's New Shoes

Toronto's banners flutter less bold,  
as Google's gears and Depot shelves,  
once bright and loud, retreat to grey.  
Trump's shadows march where colors fade,  
yet still, love's prism finds a way.  

Where corporations fear to tread,  
our footsteps forge a vibrant thread.  
In every heart, we paint the day.

Google and Home Depot both announced their plans". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
